import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import VotingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
enc = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore')

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
encoded_train = enc.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_features]).toarray()
encoded_test = enc.transform(X_test[categorical_features]).toarray()

# Concatenate encoded features with numeric features
X_train_final = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(encoded_train, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)), X_train.drop(categorical_features, axis=1)], axis=1)
X_test_final = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(encoded_test, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)), X_test.drop(categorical_features, axis=1)], axis=1)

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train_final.columns if X_train_final[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

# Define individual regressors
xgb_regressor = XGBRegressor(objective='reg:squarederror')
rf_regressor = RandomForestRegressor(n_estimators=100)
nn_regressor = MLPRegressor(hidden_layer_sizes=(100, 50), max_iter=500, random_

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler, SimpleImputer
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import VotingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice'])
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id'])

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
enc = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore')

# Impute missing values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='mean')

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
encoded_train = enc.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_features]).toarray()
encoded_test = enc.transform(X_test[categorical_features]).toarray()

# Concatenate encoded features with numeric features
X_train_numeric = imputer.fit_transform(X_train.drop(categorical_features, axis=1))
X_test_numeric = imputer.transform(X_test.drop(categorical_features, axis=1))

X_train_final = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(encoded_train, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)), pd.DataFrame(X_train_numeric)], axis=1)
X_test_final = pd.concat([pd.DataFrame(encoded_test, columns=enc.get_feature_names_out(categorical_features)), pd.DataFrame(X_test_numeric)], axis=1)

# Create preprocessing steps
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train_final.columns if X_train_final[col].dtype != 'object']
preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
    transformers=[
        ('num', StandardScaler(), numeric_features),
    ])

import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
from xgboost import XGBRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.neural_network import MLPRegressor
from sklearn.ensemble import VotingRegressor
from sklearn.metrics import mean_squared_error

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate target from predictors
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['Id', 'SalePrice']).astype(str)
X_test = test_df.drop(columns=['Id']).astype(str)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

# Initialize the encoder
enc = OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown='ignore')

# Impute missing values
imputer = SimpleImputer(strategy='mean')

# Fit the encoder on the train data and transform both train and test data
encoded_train = enc.fit_transform(X_train[categorical_features]).toarray()
encoded_test = enc.transform(X_test[categorical_features]).toarray()

# Split numeric features into numeric and non-numeric
numeric_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype != 'object']
non_numeric_features = [col for col in X_train.columns if X_train[col].dtype == 'object']

    X_test_numeric = imputer.transform(X_test[numeric_features].astype(float))
else:

    X_test_numeric = X_test.drop(non_numeric_features, axis=1).astype(float)

from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split

from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
